questions.text: Will said to ______: "Your garbage can is on fire."
questions.explanation:
Toby.

	Toby was having trouble writing the inaugural address. Seconds before Will came into his office; Toby lit a page of the address on fire and threw it into his garbage can. Will noticed it smoking. Toby took a seltzer bottle and put it out.

questions.text: What phrase did the President just learn?
questions.explanation:
'You're right'.

	Leo asked him if just learned it. Jed then informed him that Leo was right, but he was right as well.

questions.text: Where was Will planning to go on vacation?
questions.explanation:
Nice.

	Will was going to stay at a house that belonged to a friend of his family.

questions.text: Who got into a shouting match that Leo interrupted?
questions.explanation:
Josh and Amy.

	Josh: "Shut up!" Amy: "You shut up!" Leo: "Oh, God, help me some days!"

questions.text: Who was having problems with the seating in the press room?
questions.explanation:
Mitch.

	CJ moved him to the fourth row because he wasn't there as often as the other members of the press.

questions.text: Who did Fitzwallace want Josh to talk more about?
questions.explanation:
Jackie Robinson.

	Josh mentioned Jackie Robinson in reference to how good Vickie Hilton was as a pilot.

questions.text: When did Toby finally adjust to Sam?
questions.explanation:
A week ago.

	Toby told Leo this when they were talking about Will.

questions.text: How old is Josh and Jack's relationship
questions.explanation:
Seven minutes.

	Jack: "I have an aide, who, in my life, I haven't talked about as much as you've talked about Donna in our entire relationship, yours and mine, which is a cumulative total of seven minutes old."

questions.text: "I got the fuzzy end of that ___________."
questions.explanation:
Lollipop.

	This was said in response to Jack telling Josh his aide was a man after Josh offered to double date with Jack's aide's.

questions.text: What story did Josh not tell Jack about Donna?
questions.explanation:
The boyfriend story.

	Josh (to Donna): "These are endearing stories."
